alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cleveland and southwestern Pottawatomie Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 452 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to 5 miles northwest of Wanette. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norman, Moore, Pink, Tribbey, St. Louis, Etowah, Brooksville, Macomb, Stella, Lake Thunderbird, Stanley Draper Lake, Little Axe, and Trousdale. This includes Interstate 35 near mile marker 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to reduced visibilities.
